newsitem.title: INDIA: India approves Sterling Computers issue.
newsitem.headline: India approves Sterling Computers issue.

text.p: The Indian government said on Monday that it approved Sterling Computers Ltd's proposal to make a $175-million overseas private placement of shares.

A government statement said the Cabinet Committee on Foreign Investment had approved "the proposal of Sterling Computers Ltd for issue of GDR/ADR private placement of 4.8 million shares amounting to $175 million with a green shoe option of up to 15 percent".
It was referring to global depositary receipts (GDRs) and American depositary receipts (ADRs).
The statement did not indicate whether the placement would be in the form of GDRs, ADRs or a mixture of the two.
Sterling Computers is engaged in the development of cellular mobile telephone services.
